message.content:
cs.CL, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CC

Reasoning: The paper discusses the challenges of linguistic combinatoriality and rules of language in relation to theories of brain function, and proposes a connectionist approach to address these challenges. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the use of connectionist models, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE). Additionally, the paper proposes technical innovations in connectionist modelling, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) or Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper may also belong to the sub-category of Computational Complexity (cs.CC) due to its discussion of the challenges of rapid construction and transformation of compositional structures.
